Untitled 1.text: "The collapse of neo-Kantianism remains an historical mystery."

Untitled 2.text: "The attacks on Kant effectively created yet another need to go back to the historical Kant and try to reconstruct his views anew."

Untitled 3.text: "The neo-Kantians' criticisms of Kant often hit a target that is usually a neo-Kantian philosopher rather than the Sage of Königsberg himself."

Untitled 5.text: "Many of the concerns that motivate Lukacs to criticize Kant are actually concerns that Kant himself openly expressed."

Untitled 6.text: "The legacy of Kant had become both so contested and so crucial that a new generation of scholars saw the need for yet another movement back to Kant."

Untitled 7.text: "The powerful attacks on Kant in the interwar period led to a new and somewhat more careful historical and philosophical study of Kant's works."

Criticism of Kant.text: "Lukacs' criticism of Kant's philosophy as the most radical and advanced consciousness of the early bourgeoisie does not apply very well to Kant himself."
